org.elasticsearch.action.deletebyquery

Class DeleteByQueryRequest

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.elasticsearch.common.ContextHolder
      • org.elasticsearch.transport.TransportMessage<TransportRequest>
        • org.elasticsearch.transport.TransportRequest
          • org.elasticsearch.action.ActionRequest<T>
            • org.elasticsearch.action.support.replication.IndicesReplicationOperationRequest<DeleteByQueryRequest>
              • org.elasticsearch.action.deletebyquery.DeleteByQueryRequest
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IndicesRequest, IndicesRequest.Replaceable, Streamable

    public class DeleteByQueryRequest
extends IndicesReplicationOperationRequest<DeleteByQueryRequest>
    A request to delete all documents that matching a specific query. Best created with Requests.deleteByQueryRequest(String...).

    The request requires the source to be set either using source(QuerySourceBuilder), or source(byte[]).

    See Also:
    DeleteByQueryResponse, Requests.deleteByQueryRequest(String...), Client.deleteByQuery(DeleteByQueryRequest)

    • Constructor Detail

      • DeleteByQueryRequest

        public DeleteByQueryRequest(String... indices)
        Constructs a new delete by query request to run against the provided indices. No indices means it will run against all indices.

      • DeleteByQueryRequest

        public DeleteByQueryRequest()

      • DeleteByQueryRequest

        public DeleteByQueryRequest(ActionRequest originalRequest)
        Copy constructor that creates a new delete by query request that is a copy of the one provided as an argument. The new request will inherit though headers and context from the original request that caused it.
